description: {"blocks":[{"key":"be736","text":"This protocol outlines the procedures for dual-typing (genotyping and polymerase typing) of norovirus genogroups I and II (GI and GII) from wastewater. It assumes that wastewater sample collection, viral concentration and nucleic acid extraction has already been performed. The wastewater samples used during method development were processed using an ammonium sulphate precipitation (150 mL sample) followed by nucleic acid extraction using Kingfisher Flex‱ (Thermo Scientific‱, UK) and NucliSENS‱ reagents (BioMérieux, France).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":457,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":477,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":497,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2kgvb","text":"Adapting this technique for use with differing viral concentration methods and nucleic acid extraction techniques should still be suitable. The analysis of different sample matrices will also likely be possible following sample processing (up to and including nucleic acid extraction) with methods appropriate for that matrix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbk9d","text":"This protocol starts with reverse transcription followed by semi-nested PCR amplifying the RdRp+VP1 region\nof norovirus GI and GII independently. GI and GII amplicons are combined into a single library for simultaneous sequencing of the ≈1000 bp PCR products using either the Oxford Nanopore Technologies MinION or GridION. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":91,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nh3r","text":"Consensus sequences are generated using NGSpeciedID, grouped at 95% then dual-typed giving both genotype and polymerase type (e.g.GI.2[P2]). Reads are aligned to consensus sequences and PCR chimeras are filtered using reference, de novo and manual approaches.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"65B81535DADF11EE92020A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"65B81535DADF11EE92020A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"2":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"65B81535DADF11EE92020A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

The final volume will be  ; ready for use directly in end-prep for library preparation.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ai2kn","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"11.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}},"guid":"0919E7E36D344CC3A690A974E5FBAFB7"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8mf0t","text":"For samples which do not have sufficient PCR yield (200 fmol of combined GI and GII cleaned, semi-nested PCR products) undiluted, cleaned GI and GII PCR products can pooled and input into end-prep.
